State of Kentucky
Jefferson Circuit
January Term 1862
January 13. 1862
The Commonwealth Plff
against } On Scirefacias
Henry Seabolt Deft.

The deft being duly summoned and failing to answer. It is considered by the Court that the plaintiff recover of the defendant the sum of one hundred dollars the debt in the scire facias mentioned, Also her costs herein expended, And may have

A Copy att
Jas P Chambers c
Dr Sir. The above is a correct copy of a Judgement rendered at this term of the court, which I feel constrained to ask your Excellency to remit.

The deft was recognized to appear at the October Term as a witness in a misdemeanor case. He appeared at the opening of the Court but learning that the deft, his neighbor, was sick and could not attend, and supposing the case could not be tried in his ^(Defts)^ absence, he left the Court House & went home -- The case was not tried on a/c of the absence of Deft witnesses. Seabold was called upand failing to appear his bond was forfeited -- He is a poor, honest & upright young farmer; but very ignorant of legal procedure, He has heretofore attended punctually at the call of the case, and
his absence upon this occasion was the result of ignorance and not design. The collection of this judgment will greatly distress, and impoverish his family. And I hope your Excellency has sufficient confidence in me to believe that I would not appeal to you in a case that was not meritorious.

Hoping that you will remit this judgment
I remain Your Obt Svt
Jas P. Chambers

Remitted
B. M
Jefferson Cir Ct
$100. } Recog
Henry Seabolt
Issd Jany 17. 1862
